result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
- The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid during the period of probation.  If revoked,  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- Non mandatory costs, fees are waived due to inability to pay.

- No driving without a valid license.
- Commit no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- No drugs or alcohol.

- Complete driver safety plan.
- Cooperate with Agent.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

- AODA Assessment and comply with treatment.
- Random urine screens, Absolute sobriety.

- The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
- The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

timeConds.notes: At a not for profit organization.
With Huber release for work and school,  Imposed and Stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Vershawn Cobbs

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Received and Filed.  nk

9:26 AM Defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Devin Vershawn Cobbs.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to negotiations with the State, the Court DISMISSED BUT READ IN COUNTS 2 & 3 for purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing Proceeded.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 7 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is  eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
- Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with Huber release for work and school,  Imposed and Stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- AODA Assessment and comply with treatment.
- Random urine screens, Absolute sobriety.
- Maintain employment/attend school or both.
- 6 month revocation of drivers license.
- No driving without a valid license.
- Complete driver safety plan.
- Commit no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with Agent.
- No drugs or alcohol.
- Provide 50 hours of community service at a not for profit organization.
-The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid during the period of probation.  If revoked,  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Non mandatory costs, fees are waived due to inability to pay.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement   mn

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

2630 Jury Instruction

Defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Jessica Bellows for Samuel Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case scheduled for final pretrial. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court vacates 07-25-2022 jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Allysa Bria Brown for Samuel Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Childs, Br. 02.

Defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF2764. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Boyack. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision ( VIOLATION) Report; filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Devin Vershawn Cobbs in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
